SENT.plain: Nocardia asteroides is an uncommon human pathogen typically encountered in immunocompromised patients
Primary central nervous system (CNS) nocardiosis is rare and usually manifests as cerebritis or abscesses
The case of a young woman who presented with CNS Nocardia abscesses complicated by an infective middle cerebral artery aneurysm is reported
Treatment, which included abscess aspiration, aneurysm excision, and end-to-end extracranial to intracranial bypass and prolonged antibiotic therapy, resulted in an excellent outcome
This case and the management of CNS nocardiosis are reviewed
